localGuides.title: City Registration (Anmeldung)
localGuides.summary: How to register your address at the local Bürgeramt.
sections: Book an appointment at your local Bürgeramt or Bürgerbüro.
Prepare your passport, rental contract and Wohnungsgeberbestätigung.
Go to the appointment, sign the form and receive your registration certificate.
Keep the Meldebescheinigung for bank, insurance and visa processes.

localGuides.title: Residence Permit & Visa
localGuides.summary: Overview of residence titles and where to extend them.
sections: Check your current visa or residence title and its expiry date.
Find the Ausländerbehörde (foreigners' office) responsible for your city.
Collect required documents such as passport, biometric photo and proof of income.
Book an appointment well in advance and bring all original documents.

localGuides.title: Health Insurance Basics
localGuides.summary: Statutory vs private insurance and how to choose a provider.
sections: Most people in Germany are insured with statutory Krankenkassen.
Compare providers on their websites or via consultation hotlines.
Ask in your language if possible; many have Farsi or English-speaking staff.
Keep your insurance card with you for doctor visits and emergencies.

localGuides.title: Integration & Language Courses
localGuides.summary: Information about BAMF integration and language courses.
sections: Check whether you are eligible for a BAMF integration course.
Search for course providers in your city on the BAMF website.
Register for a placement test to find the right level.
Ask about cost coverage or reduced fees based on your status.
